feed.title: Dockerizalo Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Dockerizalo: v1.1.0
entry.content:
v1.1.0

What's Changed

  • feat: add support for docker labels by @undernightcore in https://github.com/undernightcore/dockerizalo/pull/3

Full Changelog: https://github.com/undernightcore/dockerizalo/commits/1.1.0

How to update

Stop Dockerizalo

shell docker compose down

Pull new images

shell docker compose pull

Start Dockerizalo again

shell docker compose up -d

entry.title: New release for Dockerizalo: v1.2.0

v1.2.0

How to update

Pull new images

Start Dockerizalo again

shell docker compose up -d

entry.title: New release for Dockerizalo: v1.3.0
entry.content:
v1.3.0

Hello everyone! üéâ

I am thrilled to introduce Docker image deployments and App templates in this release! These features bring us one step closer to full Docker Compose deployments.

‚ú® What's New?

üê≥ Image Deployments

You can now deploy single-container applications‚Äîlike databases, services, and more‚Äîdirectly from any registry!


üì¶ App Templates

Think of templates as pre-configured image deployments‚Äîthey automatically set up variables, networks, and volumes for you! üöÄ

Currently, we support PostgreSQL, and we welcome your contributions to expand our template library! (Icons from Selfhosted Icons‚Äîthank you!)

üîó Full Changelog: Compare v1.2.0 ‚Üí v1.3.0

How to update

Stop Dockerizalo

shell docker compose down

Pull new images

shell docker compose pull

Start Dockerizalo again

shell docker compose up -d

entry.title: New release for Dockerizalo: v1.4.0
entry.content:
v1.4.0 - Automatic deployments!

Hey everyone!

You can now set up webhooks that automatically build and deploy your app whenever they‚Äôre called. It works with any VCS provider ‚Äî just send a POST request and you‚Äôre good to go!

‚ú® What's New?

Triggers!

You can now create deployment triggers for any app. Head over to the Triggers section, create a new trigger, and copy its unique URL. Each time that endpoint is called, your app will automatically start building.

Use it with GitHub push events, or hook it into any system that supports HTTP requests ‚Äî it‚Äôs flexible and easy to integrate!

üîó Full Changelog: Compare v1.3.0 ‚Üí v1.4.0

How to update

Stop Dockerizalo

shell docker compose down

Pull new images

shell docker compose pull

Start Dockerizalo again

shell docker compose up -d

entry.title: New release for Dockerizalo: v1.5.0
entry.content:
v1.5.0

Hey everyone!

This might not be a huge release, but it brings a couple of nice quality-of-life improvements.

‚ú® What's New?

Pagination in Logs

Previously, all logs were captured from the moment the app started. While this wasn't an issue for apps with minimal logging, it often caused problems‚Äîsuch as crashes‚Äîfor log-heavy apps like APIs that ran for extended periods.

Now, logs are automatically paginated and limited to prevent this. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîthey‚Äôre still in real time, so you won‚Äôt miss any new logs.

Retention Policies

You can now configure how many images you want to keep for each app from the settings page. The default is 3. So, when you build a new version of your app, Dockerizalo will automatically keep only the last n images in storage.

Also, a big thank you to everyone for the amazing support Dockerizalo has received. I never imagined one of my projects would come so close to hitting 500 stars!

üîó Full Changelog: Compare v1.4.0 ‚Üí v1.5.0

How to update

Stop Dockerizalo

shell docker compose down

Pull new images

shell docker compose pull

Start Dockerizalo again

shell docker compose up -d
